conclusion: Analyze the p-V diagram to understand the process of an ideal gas from state A to state C using the first law of thermodynamics.
The image is a p-V diagram showing the change process of an ideal gas from state A to B, then B to C, with pressure plotted against volume.
Identify the process: A to B is isothermal (horizontal line), B to C is not isothermal.
Apply the first law of thermodynamics: Q = ΔU = nCvΔT for a cyclic process.
Calculate ΔU: Since temperature in state A is 27°C (300 K), and assuming constant volume from A to B, ΔU = nCv(300 - 300) = 0.
Determine heat transferred: Since ΔU = 0 for the entire process from A to C, Q is also 0.
Conclusion: No change in internal energy from A to C, indicating no heat is transferred.
